description:
Join us for an Open Studio on 19th and 20th September to explore a behind-the-scenes look at bespoke textile recycling machinery and new product and material innovations in circularity and design. 

FibreLab’s Circular Textile Recycling & Innovation Hub is made possible by support from the Hackney Wick & Fish Island Community Development Trust and The Trampery.

factsheet.heading: About FibreLab
paragraphs: FibreLab was founded in 2021 with a mission to redefine the unsustainable fashion industry and offer a solution to one of the industry’s biggest problems - waste.

Since then, we’ve been working with local fashion brands, film studios and hospitality businesses alongside students, researchers, designers and makers to develop creative, innovative, functional and aesthetically pleasing material solutions.
Using specialist machinery and proprietary processes, we transform textile waste into a new, valuable recycled fibre that can be made into countless new products.
Join us for a behind-the-scenes tour of our studio and latest innovations as we open our doors publicly for the first time on the 19th and 20th of September.

images.title:
Exterior of the FibreLab Studio on Monier Road. 
Photo credit Mooka Srisurayotin

travel_info: Additional travel info: We are a 10 minute walk from the Hackney Wick, Mildmay Overground Line, located on Monier Road.

name: Open Studio FibreLab Textile Recycling & Innovation Hub
